concept.title: To Operate the Lift Truck After a Long Time Storage

audience.otherprops: machine operators, maintenance personnel, reliability engineers, safety and compliance officers, management

othermeta.name: title
othermeta.content: To operate the lift truck after a long time in storage

othermeta.name: shortdesc
othermeta.content: Steps and safety checks to prepare and commission a lift truck that has been in long term storage prior to return to service.

othermeta.name: usecase
othermeta.content: guidance for safe recommissioning of lift trucks after long storage

ul.li: Remove covers and antirust from each of the components and exposed parts.
Drain the engine crankcase, transmission (clutch type machine), differential and final reduction gear, clean the inside of them and add new oil.
Drain off foreign matter and water from the hydraulic oil tank and fuel tank.
Remove the head cover from the engine cylinder. Oil valves and rocker shaft and check each valve for proper operation.
Add cooling water to the specified level.
Charge the battery and mount it on the machine. Connect the cables.
Perform pre - operational checks carefully. (refer to “Before Starting the Engine”)
If deteriorated DEF/Ad-Blue warning lamp turns on and message appears, drain the fluid in the DEF/Ad-Blue tank thoroughly and refill with new DEF/Ad-Blue.
Check level of DEF/Ad-Blue and if necessary refill DEF/Ad-Blue (refer page.90)
